docTitle.titlePart:
Pilot{Symbol{Aided Channel Estimation
in Time and Frequency

byline.docAuthor: Peter Hoeher, Stefan Kaiser, and Patrick Robertson

byline.affiliation: Institute for Communications Technology, German Aerospace Research Establishment (DLR)

front.div:
Abstract
The potentials of pilot-symbol-aided channel estimation in
two dimensions are explored for mobile radio and broadcast-
ing applications. In order to procure this goal, the discrete
shift-variant 2-D Wiener is analyzed given an arbitrary
sampling grid, an arbitrary (but possibly optimized) selec-
tion of observations, and the possibility of model mismatch.
In addition, the classical scheme using two separate 1-D FIR
lters is analysed. Filtering in two dimensions is revealed
to outperform in just one dimension with respect to
overhead, mean-square error performance and latency. Con-
ceptually, the discrete shift-variant 2-D Wiener lter is the
optimal linear estimator for the given problem, however, two
cascaded orthogonal 1-D are simpler to implement and
virtually as good as true 2-D lters. Analytical results are
presented, veriied by Monte-Carlo simulations.
